sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {p, q, r} and B = {q, r, s}. Find the symmetric difference of A and B and evaluate (A△B) x (B△A), and show that the result is not equal to (AxB) $\bigtriangleup$ (BxA).
